title: Deputy 'overwhelmed' by calls to stop Guernsey pavement driving
text:
21 February 2017 at 1:34pm Deputy 'overwhelmed' by calls to stop Guernsey pavement driving 
A Guernsey deputy says he has been "overwhelmed" by calls from islanders to stop people driving on the pavements at "considerable" speed. 
Deputy Peter Roffey says he has been inundated with responses after he raised the issue in the States Assembly. 
Pavement-surfing happens when roads are too narrow for cars to pass each other. 
Deputy Roffey calls the action "dangerous" and has now written to the Chief of Police and President of Home Affairs about the problem. 
In a letter he asks for a concentrated and high-profile effort to tackle the issue in specific areas where it happens regularly. 
The letter acknowledges it is necessary at times, but the speed and frequency is concerning. Last updated Tue 21 Feb 2017
